result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:58 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mackenzie L. Busalacchi appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Luke Harrison appeared by video for Mackenzie L. Busalacchi. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess schedule I or II narcotic, possess heroin, possess drug paraphernalia and felony bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-11-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash with the condition that she maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Minutes.
